question: can work sack me with doctors notes?
question_content: I have problems with my feet and back,was off work a few months ago with this for 4months and had physio and saw a specialist with my feet,they found out what the problem was and sorted it for me,but im off again with same problem and got doctors notes.My company was good last time and helped me but as im off again with the same problem and seeing my doc and going back to specialist can they sack me?

answers.answer_content:
Well, if you keep not showing up to work?  I would say, "Yeah."

I don't know the legal ramifications, but I do know from an employer's point of view, a worker who is constantly unable to maintain a good working schedule is not a benefit to the bottom line and the shareholders.

Depends on the company and if your state is an at will state. Meaning you can get fired anytime for any reason. Usually if you have a chronic health issue and provide notes each time you are off you won't get the boot. Maybe you should take a medical leave until you can get your feet well. A company can't afford to keep having it's employees out of work.

I don't think so, however is depends on the company and how their policy of absences are written.  Most of the time Dr.'s notes will cover you.  My suggestion would be that if you need to be out because of your medical problems, I would see if the company offers short term disability or family medical leave.  Both will protect your job.  Keep the Dr's notes and keep getting them every time you go.
